intro: Eriocoelum kerstingii var. katangense, commonly known as the Katanga sedge, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, triangular stems and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist soil conditions. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
